Script:
W-Am: Q1 Alex, did you get an update from Fryer Airport about our contract to run our advertising campaign in Terminal C?
M-Au: Yes, their representative said that we can start our ads by the beginning of May.
W-Am: OK. And what about the digital advertisements that we would run on flat-screens? Q2 They have enough screens available? We need at least four around the terminal.
M-Au: You know, they said they’re in the process of installing additional screens right now. But Q3 let me call home back right away just to make sure they’ll be ready in time.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
choices: (B) A delay in a construction project

question.text: What does the woman ask the man to confirm?
What is the man do next?

answer.explanation:
M-Cn : Q1 To start today's meeting, I'd like to talk about the recent drop in sales for our vitamins. Does anyone have any ideas?
W-Br: You know, Q2 what we really should do is start advertising on social media Web sites. That would increase our client base and give Nectar Vitamins a more modern image. Bob, didn't you create ads for social media at your last job?
M-Au: Yes, I did, I was responsible for promoting all of our products online.
W-Br: That's great. Q3 Well, Bob, would you be willing to present some tips on online advertising at our next team meeting?
M-Au: Sure. I can do that.

question.text: What problem does the company have?
What does the woman suggest?

choices: (A) Set up a conference call with clients
(C) Share information at a team meeting

answer.text: (C) Share information at a team meeting

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W: Hi, Mr. Winston. This is Sharon Smith. I was the person interested in buying the used Speedster sports car that you showed me last week. I checked my financial situation and I’ve decided to go ahead with the purchase.
M: Hi, Ms. Smith. Well, unfortunately, we already sold that car to somebody yesterday. However, I have a similar model that you could look at. The car is used, but it is in great shape and just had new tires put on it.
W: Oh, that’s too bad that you already sold the model. That car had a really good safety rating, which is what I consider most important when buying a car.
M: I see. Well, this similar model also has a five-star safety rating. Why don’t you come here this week? You can take a look at it and take it for a test drive.

question.text: What type of business does the man work for?
What does the woman say is her top priority when she makes a purchase?
What does the man suggest doing?

answer.explanation:
W: Hello, this is Kelly in the accounting department. The ink cartridge in the printer on the fourth floor has run out. Do you think you could come to replace it today?
M: Sure. By the way, can I ask you a favor? I need you to let me know what model the machine is so I can bring the correct one. Actually, I’m not in the office right now, so I can’t see what it is.
W: OK. But how can I find out that information? Do I have to open the printer cover or press some function buttons?
M: No, you don’t, Just ask Mr. Hills in your department. He should have a complete list of all the hardware on the fourth floor.

question.text: What problem is the woman reporting?
choices: (A) An accounting error has been made.
(B) A printer is out of order.
(C) Some office supplies have been used up.

answer.text: (C) Some office supplies have been used up.

question.text: What does the man ask the woman to do?
What is mentioned about Mr. Hills?
choices: (A) He is in charge of a new project.
(B) He is in the same department as the woman.
(C) He has recently ordered a new item.

answer.text: (B) He is in the same department as the woman.

Transcript
M-Cn Congratulations on your new position as video director! I was surprised to hear about that position. 59Since we're an art supply store, I didn't realize we needed a video director.
W-Br Thanks. I know; it's a bit of an unusual position, isn't it? But with Internet shopping becoming more popular, stores really need to have a large Internet presence. 60 I'll be in charge of creating how-to videos that'll be posted online.
M-Cn That makes sense. And it sounds very interesting! What's your current project?
W-Br Well, we've just filmed the first video on how to make your own beaded necklace. It's on our Web site. Actually... 61could you tell me what you think of it?

Transcript:
W-Br Hi, Brian, and welcome! I'm Cindy Stapleton, and I'll be your manager. 68l assume you remember the general floor layout from when you interviewed here?
We have a few available offices on this floor that you can choose from.
M-Au Thanks! I'd like to have a quiet work space, if possible. Any recommendations?
W-Br Hm. Office One is taken... and it's probably noisy by the kitchen or near the conference room. 69How about the office right here, next to the front door?
M-Au Great! Thanks. Now—70how do I log into the computer network?
W-Br Oh, 70 we'll do that later. Once you've settled in, come by my desk. Then I'll show you how to log in.

question.text: Why is the man familiar with the office?
choices: (D)He was given a tour by a friend.

question.text: Look at the graphic. Which office does the woman recommend?
What  will the woman explain later?

answer.explanation:
M: Hey Judy, did you see the new offices the company built? They look fantastic.
W: Yeah, it’s about time!
M: I know we had some slow years, but the last five years everyone has worked so hard and now it’s finally paying off.
W: Our company’s growth has been fast, but there has been a lot of long nights and hard work.
M: I agree with you. But it is nice to see it finally paying off. I can’t wait to move into my new office!

question.text: What did the company do recently?
What does the woman mean when she says “it’s about time!”?
choices: (A) She thinks the company deserves new offices.
(B) She thinks construction has taken too long.
(C) She doesn’t like the new offices.
(D) She wants a raise in her salary.

answer.text: (A) She thinks the company deserves new offices.

question.text: What does the woman imply about the company?
choices: (A) They have been very lucky to grow so fast.
(B) Some of the staff is not working hard.
(C) The company worked hard to grow fast.
(D) The new offices aren’t very nice.

answer.text: (C) The company worked hard to grow fast.

answer.explanation:
W: Hello. I’m interested in enrolling in your school’s vocational training program to become a dental assistant, but I couldn’t find any information about tuition on your website.
M: Thank you for your interest. We offer a two- semester training program to become a dental assistant at our community college. Tuition for a single semester is $6,500.
W: Oh, I see. Honestly, that is a little more than I expected. I will have to ask my bank about the possibility of getting a student loan. Is there anything else you can tell me?
M: Well, one thing to keep in mind is that our community college offers night classes for all our programs. This is very good for students who work during the day. And please remember that we are one of the top-ranked schools in the state, and so far more than 5,000 of our graduates have become dental assistants.

question.text: What career is the woman interested in?
What does the woman say she will do?

W: Hi, this is Rachel. Q1 I’m calling to see if I can upgrade from coach to business for my flight to Q2 Thailand this June.
M: OK, can I have your membership number please?
W: Yes, it’s EM3985771.
M: Q3 I’m sorry. You don’t have enough points for this trip. However, I see that you’re traveling to Korea and Japan next week. That should give you enough points to upgrade in June. Why don’t you call again after your trip?
W: OK, that’s a great idea. I’ll call again in two weeks.

(C) To cancel her flight to Singapore

answer.explanation:
W-Am: I can’t wait to hear William McGraw’s speech today! I’ve read so many of his articles on risk management. l think this is one of the best business management conferences I’ve ever attended
M-Au: I know, and there are so many people here! It looks like the only available seats are here in the back. Let’s just sit in this row.
W-Am: The last row? I think we can do better. I’d like to see the slides that go with the presentation up close.
M-Au: Oh, don’t worry about that. Look over there! There’re presentation handouts piled up close to the front entrance. I’ll get a copy for you if you'd like.

question.text: What type of event are the speakers attending?
Why does the woman say, "I think we can do better"?
choices: (A) She prefers to try another option.
(B) She wants to encourage the man to work harder.
(C) She is disappointed in the quality of the presentation.
(D) She thinks her team is more competent than other teams.

answer.text: (A) She prefers to try another option.

question.text: What does the man say about the presentation handouts?
choices: (B) They are available near the entrance.
(C) There are not enough copies for everyone.

answer.text: (B) They are available near the entrance.

answer.explanation:
M: Hello, Ms. Turner. This is Michael Schmidt calling from the Yorkshire Seaside Hotel. It says here that you would like to be informed if a seaside room became available. Q1 Well, someone has just canceled, so if you would like to upgrade, you may.
W: Oh, great. Thanks so much for informing me. Q2 How much more is the upgraded room compared to the standard room?
M: Well, it will cost an extra $50 a night. However, the room comes with a larger bed and a hot tub. I recommend you visit our website to see pictures and information on the room.
W: OK. Q3 I’ll look at your website and then call you back with my decision.

question.text: Why is the man calling?
What does the woman inquire about?
What does the woman say she will do?

answer.explanation:
M: So Q1 what do you think about that office space we looked at? Should we take it?
W: Well, Q2 we’d be in the same area, and the cost is right, but it does need some repairs.
M: Yes, you’re right. It does need work, a lot in fact. And some storage compartments will have to be installed. But the size is perfect for our company.
W: Well, Q3 I suppose we could hire a contractor to help with the work. So, yes, let’s consider renting it.

M-Au: Hello, this is Ian Kowalski from the personnel department. I just got into work, and Q1 when I tried to log on to my computer, my password was rejected.
W-Br: I’m sorry about that, Mr. Kowalski. The company updated its security protocols last night, and since then we've received a lot of calls about password problems. Q2 At this point, every member of the IT support team is working on one of those other requests so it may be several hours before one of them can call you back.
M-Au: That's OK. I'm leading a recruiting workshop at ten and it goes until noon, Q3 so I won't be back at my desk until twelve-thirty. Please call me then as I have another appointment at one o'clock.

question.text: When does the man ask the support team to call him?

answer.explanation: Q1&2 We are pleased to announce that the company will be opening its very own cafeteria for employees next month. Now, if you forget to bring your lunch to work, you won’t have to leave the building to get a delicious and nutritious lunch. The cafeteria will feature sandwiches, soups, and hot entrees at reasonable prices. Salads, snacks, coffee, tea, and soda will also be available. Q3 Each week on Monday morning, the chef will post the menu on the bulletin board near the entrance. Our growth in the industry this year has allowed us to make this much-needed improvement to our work environment

question.text: Who is the intended audience for this announcement?
When will the change take place?
Where will information be posted?
choices: (C) On the front door of the building
(D) Near the entrance to the cafeteria

answer.text: (D) Near the entrance to the cafeteria

answer.explanation: I’d like to start off today's meeting by thanking you for taking our survey. Q1 Here at R&M Auto Factory, we're committed to employee satisfaction. We received a lot of suggestions for improving our factory’s cafeteria, so let’s take a look at those results now. As you can see, we’d all like a larger dining area, but we just can’t afford an expansion right now. Q2 We can, however, address the second most popular suggestion, so we’ll start working on that immediately. And, as a token of our thanks, Q3 everyone who filled out the survey will receive a voucher for a free lunch.

question.text: Where does the talk take place?

Transcript:
Q1 Well, it’s only been one year since I took over the position of Company President. Since then our products have become the most sought-after watches in the world. Our unique designs, excellent price point, and promotional campaigns have proven to be miraculous. This has led to a lot of media attention. The worldwide CNU Business channel wants to run a special story about our company next month. Q2 They are sending some reporters to interview me on Wednesday and take some video footage of our manufacturing processes. Q3 You realize what this means. CNU is broadcasted globally, and this could cause our business to grow even more.

question.text: According to the speaker, what has happened to the company in the last year? ụ
choices: (A) Their products have gained global success.

answer.text: (A) Their products have gained global success.

answer.explanation: Hi Jalil. This is Kira calling from Seaside Dental. 75You have an appointment for next week, but you asked me to let you know if an earlier appointment opened up. Well, I’m calling because we just had a cancellation for this afternoon at four o’clock, so you can see the dentist today if you can come in then. Please call as soon as possible to let me know. Also, remember, that our office is in a different location now. We’re in the same building, but we’ve moved to the ground floor.

question.text: Where does the speaker work?
Why is the speaker calling?
choices: (B) To offer a different appointment time

answer.text: (B) To offer a different appointment time

question.text: What does the speaker say has recently changed?

answer.explanation: Hi, Ms. Patel. This is Shelly from Valley Landscape Company. l was working on your property today, and I took a look at the area where you wanted me to plant a flower garden. Well, the problem is, that area doesn't get much sun, so only a few types of flowers will grow there. I know you really liked the flowers you chose for that spot, but I hope you can be flexible. l left a catalog in your mailbox, and I suggest you look it over. I’d like to finish landscaping your yard this week, so please call me back and let me know your decision as soon as possible.

question.text: Why is the speaker calling the customer?
choices: (A) To discuss a problem with a project
(D) To apologize for a delayed order

answer.text: (A) To discuss a problem with a project

choices: (A) A different worker will complete a project.
(B)  A deadline will not be met.
(C) A product selection should be changed
(D) A price is higher than expected.

question.text: What did the speaker leave for the customer?

answer.explanation: I’d like to start our weekly personnel department meeting with a hiring update for the Dubai office. As you know, we’ve been working hard to fill several managerial positions there by the beginning of summer. So far, we haven’t received any applications from qualified candidates outside the company, and well, the deadline to submit was May 15. So, since several current employees have applied, I want the team to start interviewing them next week. Please be on the lookout for the interview schedule, which I'll e-mail you shortly.

question.text: Who most likely is the speaker?

choices: (A) She missed a good job opportunity.
(B) She needs to verify some details.
(C) She must move forward with a task.
(D) She forgot to notify a colleague.

answer.text: (C) She must move forward with a task.

question.text: According to the speaker, what will happen next week?

answer.explanation: So now that you've all had a chance to see the museum’s collection of abstract paintings. I’d like you to come out into the garden with me, where our collection of eighteenth-century sculptures is on display. This collection was generously donated to us by art collector Emily Wellman two months ago. I’ll tell you about two sculptures in particular Also, if you’re interested in the collection more generally, l would highly recommend the short documentary about the collection, which is showing in the theater near the exit on the other side of the garden.

question.text: Where is the talk taking place?
According to the speaker, what has Emily Wellman recently done?
What does the speaker recommend that the listeners do?

answer.explanation: Great news everybody! Quarterly profits are up 23%. The introduction of our new range of body washes has exceeded all of our expectations. Our other products have continued to sell well, particularly our facial creams and hand creams. Last month our products were featured in En Vogue magazine, and they had a three-page story on the quality of our manufacturing process. This must have helped with our sales increase. We are expecting more media exposure in the following months, and the release of several new products. How about that? I’m proud of all the work you have put into this quarter. Let's keep it up!

question.text: What type of products are being discussed?
According to the speaker, what happened last month?
choices: (B) A product launch went better than expected.
(C) Their products were featured in a magazine.
(D) Another company took over their contract.

answer.text: (C) Their products were featured in a magazine.

question.text: What does the woman mean when she says “How about that?”
choices: (B) She expected a customer return policy.
(C) She wants to purchase some products.
(D) She is happy with the company’s progress.

answer.text: (D) She is happy with the company’s progress.

answer.explanation:
Script:
W-Br: Hi, this is Jane Smith. 80 I’m calling from Universal Construction Supplies for Rahim Ali. We received your application, and we’re interested in bringing you in for an interview. 81 We need someone who has experience managing a warehouse, and we see that you’re doing that at your current job. Are you available to come in Monday at three P.M for an interview? Although you’d be working in the construction supply warehouse, we’d interview you at our headquarters. 82 The office is a little tricky to find, so if you’re interested, call back and I can give you directions. The number is 555-0121.

question.text: Where does the speaker work?
What job experience does the speaker mention?

choices: (A) It is located in another city.

answer.explanation:
Script:
M-Au: Looking for a great place to eat? Come to Cooper’s Restaurant! 71 City Sights Magazine recognized ys as one of the top ten restaurants in Pearl City for using all locally grown fruits and vegetables in our dishes. 72 Cooper’s is conveniently located in the heart of the entertainment district, so it’s the perfect place to enjoy a meal before a play or concert. Call today for a reservation. We’re open every day from eleven A.M to midnight. 73 To see our menu and the list of daily specials, visit our Web site. We hope to see you soon!

question.text: According to the speaker, what is the restaurant known for?
According to the speaker, what is near the restaurant?
Why should listeners visits a Web site?
The crew members  _____ the main section of the building by the time the waste removal trucks arrive at 3:30.

answer.explanation:
Time clause
=> Choose B

question.text: _____  the candidate’s official announcement that he will run for office, he met privately with his advisors.

answer.explanation:
As long as + Clause => B is wrong
Among 3 option A,C, D: Based on the meaning of words
=>Choose A

question.text: If Ms. Kamano leaves at 2:00, she ___ at the station on time.

answer.explanation: (B) Present tense in the “if clause” can be matched with future tense in the second clause. Choice (A) is present perfect conditional. Choice (C) is past tense. Choice (D) is present tense but indicates an unreal condition.

question.text: Brock’s Bistro has requested that we _______ the number of dinner guests by Monday.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> C

question.text: ___ pleased the clients most was the effective customer service Moradon Bank provided.

answer.explanation: What = The thing

question.text: Please provide as many ------- as possible when leaving a message for the technical-support team.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: No passengers are allowed on board  _____  the aircraft’s door has been closed.

answer.explanation:
use conjunction
=> Choose C

question.text: Ms. Drew was able to attend the popular summer marketing seminar in Lisbon ------ she bought her tickets early.

answer.explanation: Due to the following clause is the cause of the preceding clause.

question.text: In an attempt  _____  sustainable energy, city officials have had solar panels affixed to some public buildings.
The loan application process at Palau Bay Bank is very ___.

answer.explanation:
The answer comes after "be" and an adverb so we use an adjective.
Efficient = Waste little time and energy

question.text: Those who attend the creative writing workshop will learn a variety of useful methods  _____ the next two days.

answer.explanation:
over + ... days/weeks/years/months
=> Choose D

question.text: Construction of the Yukimura Building______  because of modifications in the architectural plans.

answer.explanation: passive voice

question.text: Rose's Bistro will close next month due to escalating operating  _____.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>A

question.text: The Moore Landmark Society has asked that city council members ___ the demolition of

answer.explanation: Ask that sb do st

question.text: Products made by Izmir Vitamins are designed to promote ___ and well-being.

answer.explanation: Because one of the two objects is a noun so the answer should also be a noun.

question.text: Noted author Neha Dehuri will be signing copies of her ___ acclaimed book The Forgotten, on Sunday at the Gloucester University Bookstore.

answer.explanation:
We are giving more information on the verb "acclaimed" so we use an adverb.
Critically acclaimed = Complimented by professionals

question.text: Although they usually leave at 6:00 P.M., the employees are ------- in the store preparing for tomorrow's big event.

answer.explanation: [be] was + adverb + V3/ed

question.text: A ___ from Jensen-Coimes Corporation will be happy to meet with prospective job applicants at the Westborough Job Fair.

answer.explanation: The answer comes after the word "a" so we choose a noun. Representative = sb who speak or vote for a group.

question.text: Any decorations on the ceiling or walls must be fully removed, including any material used to ------- them to the surfaces.

answer.explanation: Based on structure "adhere + to"

question.text: The ___ about our recycling plans will reassure consumers.

answer.explanation: (D) The sentence requires a noun subject. Choice (A) is a noun but is not logical. Choice (B) is a verb. Choice (C) is a gerund.

question.text: Mesmio, provider of premium television content, welcomes  ______ ideas for improving our service.

answer.explanation: Need an adj to modify the Noun "idea"

question.text: Ms. Vialobos has reported that the new mobile telephones are the lightest ___ to be purchased by the department.

answer.explanation: The + superlative adj + ever to do st

question.text: At the guest’s _____, an extra set of towels and complimentary soaps were brought to the room.

answer.explanation:
-	Based on the meaning of words
=>Choose C

question.text: Lim Myung Hee, vice president of public relations, will ___ Kavi Financial at the shareholder meeting on February 14.

answer.explanation: Represent sb/st = Go instead of sb/st

question.text: The ___ fee for any of the Logistics Management courses is €25 a person.

answer.explanation: N + fee = Price for st

question.text: As ______ by the researchers, the new environmentally friendly laundry detergent performed as well as its competitors.

answer.explanation:
This argument reduces passive clause clause.
As observed = As it is observed.

question.text: Please refer to the employee handbook for further instructions relating ___ requests for vacation and personal leave.

answer.explanation: Related to st

question.text: Passengers must present their passport ___ their boarding pass to Lunar Airlines’ personnel when checking in for a flight.

answer.explanation: Along with = In addition to

question.text: All of the trees on the property were damaged in the storm _____ the one near entrance.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=>Choose A

question.text: The chief operating officer has asked the members of the research team to clarify ___ findings.

answer.explanation:
The answer comes before a noun so we use "their"
Clarify st = Make st easy to understand

question.text:
Sunnyville Daily Times


Local News
(5 May) - On Monday, following a city council meeting, Mayor Tom Biel announced the introduction of training programs for aspiring city transportation workers. During the press conference, he noted the current (1) _____ for both drivers and mechanics. (2) _____ , he pointed to a wave of employee retirements as having triggered these urgent staffing needs. The announcement (3) _____ with approval by most city officials. However, Nelton District Representative Laura Ochoa was unconvinced. (4) _____.
During the press conference, he noted the current (1) _____ for both drivers and mechanics.

answer.explanation: Based on the context and translation of the sentence, we choose the answer C: demand

question.text: (2) _____ , he pointed to a wave of employee retirements as having triggered these urgent staffing needs

answer.explanation: The sentence behind him is clearer, so we choose the proper adverb meaning A: Specifically

question.text: The announcement (3) _____ with approval by most city officials.

answer.explanation: Look behind with the most city officials => passive answer, select answer D

question.text: However, Nelton District Representative Laura Ochoa was unconvinced. (4) _____.
choices: (A) She expects ticket prices to fall in response to complaints.
(B) She thinks the driver's license test should be more thorough.
(C) She wants to recruit workers who are already skilled.
(D) She feels it is too early to start replacing the city’s buses.

answer.text: (C) She wants to recruit workers who are already skilled.
answer.explanation: Based on context and translation of sentence.

question.text:
Questions 139-142 refer to the following article.
For the first time ever, riders in the Cloverville Bicycle Race (139.) ------- to use the city's main streets. On Tuesday, the city council engaged in a heated debate. (140.) -------. As a result, the council finally voted in favor of allowing the race, now scheduled for September 9, to run right (141.) ------- the center of Cloverville before it proceeds across the Munn River Bridge. In recent years, some riders have complained that the course was too short. (142.) -------, this year's course has been lengthened slightly by including the Munn River Bridge crossing as part of the route.

answer.explanation:
The position to fill is in the middle of the sentence and before that there is no special verb so the verb to fill cannot be divided as "to V". In addition, this sentence does not use relative clauses, so it is possible to exclude Option B. With the remaining 2 options, in terms of meaning, C is correct.
is to permit: must be allowed
will be allowed

choices: (A) Longtime opponent Tim Howard was persuaded to change his mind.
(B) The new course will include rest stops where riders can receive refreshments.
(C) The first race in CLoverville was approved by council members eight years ago.
(D) The old course made a detour around the downtown area.

answer.text: (A) Longtime opponent Tim Howard was persuaded to change his mind.
answer.explanation: The content of the previous sentence is "On Tuesday, the city council participated in a heated debate". So in the answers given, answer A is the most appropriate because it refers to a change of opinion, related to the debate.
As a result, the council finally voted in favor of giving The race license, currently scheduled for September 9, is run through the city center.
Based on the meaning, choose the correct answer.

question.text:
Learn social media marketing tactics only at Genius Marketing’s Power Conference
Are you ready to take your social media marketing to the next level? Then (1) ______ Genius Marketing’s Power Conference and learn cutting-edge social media marketing tactics. (2) ______ This could be the most educational two days of your year.
Genius Marketing will give you real-world tactics to boost your paid and organic social media marketing efforts. (3) ______ you buy social media advertising or focus on organic social media engagement, Genius Marketing’s Power Conference is the conference you need to attend this year. You’ll be inspired by experts, meet others with your challenges, and get actionable tactics to drive traffic, increase sales and (4) ______ customer satisfaction.
To apply, just click the link below.
Then (1) ______ Genius Marketing’s Power Conference and learn cutting-edge social media marketing tactics.

answer.explanation:
“Then Genius Marketing's Power Conference and learn cutting-edge social media marketing tactics. ”
 => then + [...] + ... + and + learn

The conjugate "and" connects two equivalent words, finds that "learn" is the infinitive => the verb following "then" is also in its infinitive form.

question.text: (2) ______ This could be the most educational two days of your year.
choices: (A) Guide people in the industry to great ness by joining today.
(B) The conference will be in Houston on May 3 and 4.
(C) Registration for this two-week course will be on November 20.
(D) Classes will be held throughout the month of March.

answer.text: (B) The conference will be in Houston on May 3 and 4.
answer.explanation: Answer B is meaningful in terms of relevance and is linked to the previous as well as the next.

question.text: (3) ______ you buy social media advertising or focus on organic social media engagement, Genius Marketing’s Power Conference is the conference you need to attend this year.

answer.explanation: The Structure "Whether ... or ..."

question.text: You’ll be inspired by experts, meet others with your challenges, and get actionable tactics to drive traffic, increase sales and (4) ______

answer.explanation: In terms of meaning, only answer B is appropriate

question.text:

Based on the meaning of the words to choose the correct answer

question.text:
Thank you for shopping at Marlowe’s! Please fill out this questionnaire in order to help us better understand customer needs.


1. How often do you visit Marlowe’s?

__Daily __Weekly __Monthly


2. How much do you spend on an average visit?
_Under$20_$20-$40 _$40-$60
_$60-$80 _$80-$100_Over$100


3. What kinds of products did you purchase today?

    _ Uniforms for chefs and waiters
    _ Cookware (pots, pans)
    _ Tableware (glasses, plates, cutlery)

Name (optional): Sajiv Patel

What type of business is Marlowe's?

Information in the lines: "What kinds of products did you purchase today?
_ Uniforms for chefs and waiters
_ Cookware (pots, pans)
_ Tableware (glasses, plates, cutlery)
_ Professional cleaning supplies

question.text: How much does Mr. Patel usually spend at Marlowe's?

question.text:
Deadline for Classified Advertisements
 
The deadline for placing classified advertisements in the Skillington Weekly is Tuesday morning at 11:00, for publication on Wednesday. After initial text is received, changes will not be accepted. We reserve the right to edit any text.

All ads are prepaid. Ads scheduled to run for more than one week may be canceled after the first week for future advertising credit only. Email the text of your ad to ads@skillingtonweekly.com. Discounts are available for multiple ads.
 
Call 555-0163 for pricing.
What will happen if an advertiser submits an ad on Wednesday morning?
choices: (A) The ad will appear the following Wednesday.
(B) The ad will be published later that day.
(C) The ad will appear only in the online edition.
(D) The ad will cost the advertiser more money.

answer.text: (A) The ad will appear the following Wednesday.
answer.explanation: According to the content of the announcement, in order for the advertisement to appear in the 4th newspaper of this week, it must be submitted before 11am on Tuesday. Therefore, if it is submitted on Wednesday morning, it will be printed on the next week's issue.

question.text: According to the notice, when do advertisers receive credit?
choices: (A) When they place a full-page ad
(C) When the newspaper edits an ad
(D) When the newspaper misprints an ad

answer.explanation: In the announcement, only the first sentence of paragraph 2 mentions advertising costs. Accordingly, payment must be made before an advertisement is posted. So if an advertiser cancels the sent ad, it will get back the paid amount. So the chosen answer is B.

question.text:
Linda Bates 6:55
I'm late. I woke up late.
Melinda Cruz 6:56
When can I expect you?
Linda Bates 6:57
I'll be there in an hour.
Melinda Cruz 6:58
Should I leave without you?
Linda Bates 7:02
Mo, just make sure the van is loaded when I get there.
Melinda Cruz 7:02
Will do.
Linda Bates 7:03
Thanks.
Melinda Cruz 7:08
I'll see you soon. Drive carefully.
Linda Bates 7:10
Yep. I am.
What is suggested about Ms. Bates?
choices: (B) She is being held up by traffic.
(C) She is currently operating an automobile.

answer.text: (C) She is currently operating an automobile.
answer.explanation:
“No, just make sure the van is loaded when I get there”.
- Eliminate A, B, D because there is no information in the article.

question.text: At 7:02, what does Ms. Cruz mean when she writes, “Will do”?
choices: (A) She will be waiting for Ms. Cruz.
(B) She plans to load the vehicle.
(C) She is frustrated by Ms. Bate’s tardiness.
(D) She has finished parking the van.

answer.text: (B) She plans to load the vehicle.
answer.explanation:
“- No, just make sure the van is loaded when I get there.

- Will do ”.

question.text:
April 2 — Repairs will begin next Friday on the historic Marion Hall in downtown Marion. In its heyday, Marion Hall was a popular downtown destination for residents to dance, enjoy live music, and watch movies. However, it has lost its popularity gradually since the multiplex building was completed on Henson Street 4 years ago.
After all of the necessary repairs are made on Marion Hall, city officials will strive to invite various performers including famous theater companies, musicians, comedians, and speakers to the newly renovated theater. “We hope Marion Hall can serve as a new center for culture here in Marion,” said Marion City Mayor Greg Fields.
The revitalization of Marion Hall is part of a larger project to enhance the public facilities in Marion. On April 29, the Marion Children’s Park, which features a baseball field as well as several playgrounds, is scheduled to have its grand reopening.
What is suggested about Marion?
choices: (A) It will restore an old building soon.
(B) It has closed a park for repairs.
(C) It is planning a music festival.

answer.text: (A) It will restore an old building soon.
answer.explanation: The information is in: "Repairs will begin next Friday on the historic Marion Hall in downtown Marion."

question.text: What is the purpose of Marion Hall?
choices: (A) To serve as a play center for children

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: " In its heyday, Marion Hall was a popular downtown destination for residents to dance, enjoy live music, and watch movies."

question.text: What will happen in April?
choices: (A) A famous speaker will give a presentation.
(B) A new major will be elected
(C) Some public facilities will be improved
(D) A new play will be performed

answer.text: (C) Some public facilities will be improved
answer.explanation: Based on the information in: "After all of the necessary repairs are made on Marion Hall, city officials will strive to invite various performers including famous theater companies, musicians, comedians, and speakers to the newly renovated theater. “We hope Marion Hall can serve as a new center for culture here in Marion,” said Marion City Mayor Greg Fields."

question.text:
To:               Geoffrey Breen
From:          Gagan Chopra
Subject       Information
Date:           24 March
Attachment: Chopral

Dear Geoffrey:

This is to remind you that beginning next Monday I will be on vacation for three weeks  in Jaipur. — [1] —. I am providing you with a list of  the current  book  projects  that I am overseeing that includes the manuscript due dates as well as other pertinent information about each project. — [2] —. I know you have a lot to do as editor-in-chief, so I have asked a colleague to oversee my projects while I’m away.

Ian Pressler has been working closely with me for the past few months on travel .ind finance titles, so he is well aware of the ongoing projects in this area and will se that things go smoothly. We had a lunch meeting yesterday at the new restaura it near Anderson Market to go over them. — [3] —. Ian will make certain the app appropriate e-mail reminders are sent out to the authors whose projects are nearing co npletion. I will have limited Internet access while traveling, but I will resJ ond to me: sages as quickly as possible. — [4]---

Kind regards,
Gagan Chopra
Where most likely does Mr. Chopra work?
What does Mr. Chopra write that Mr. Pressler will do?

In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3], and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
“While there, we put together a project list, which includes all of the associated tasks.”

PRIVATE SALE

This 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom property sits on a 2,000-square-foot elevated site in a location overlooking the Botanical Gardens. It is convenient to the Central Business District and public transportation. The home has been fully upgraded to include modern appliances, new carpets, and air-conditioning. The property includes a detached, refurbished office. Off-street parking is available.
Property valuation (January): $325,000
No agents, please.
Listing #: PA39384
What is being advertised?

answer.explanation: Maybe See right from the headline “Private sale” or words in the article like “3-bedroom 2-bathroom” showing a private home.

question.text: Where is the property?

answer.explanation: In a location overlooking the Botanical Gardens, the article describes the location of the house. That means this house is located near the botanical garden.

question.text: What is indicated about the property?
choices: (C) It is being sold through a real estate agency.

answer.explanation: It is stated in the article that “Off-street parking is available” (There is parking on the street crossing). That means this property does not have a private garage.

question.text:
Travel & Recreation

123 Gilmore street

Orange County, CA 48857


November 15
Mr. Peter Kang
3820 Rivervalley Heights
Seattle, WA 19387

We at Travel & Recreation thank you for your subscription to our magazine. As you have been a long time subscriber, I am excited to inform you about our new subscription plan for our VIP members. - [1] - As a member, you will continue to receive monthly editions of our magazine and access to our new online e-magazine services. You can simply download a digital version of the print magazine to any mobile device at no extra cost. -[2] - Furthermore, you can access background information about our authors, journalists, and guest writers, as well as detailed information about the locations and places that are covered in the magazine. In addition, you can access the recipes to the most popular restaurants around the world and, most exciting of all, we will hold an exclusive competition for our VIP members with a chance to win a trip for two to Hawaii. -[3] - Our regular subcribers, as well as VIP members, will have a chance to win a dining experience at 5-star restaurant Bellisimo.

Again we thank you for your continued support and we hope you enjoy the many changes we have made to our services as we strive to entertain and educate our loyal subscribers. - [4] - Please fill out the application form that is attached to this letter. Please check which subscription plan you wish to join. If you send in a $100 fee, you will receive the regular subscription plan. If you send in $200 fee, you will become a VIP member.

We appreciate your support and hope to hear from you soon.

Sincerely,
Victoria Adams
Why was a letter sent to Mr. Kang?
choices: (A) To remind him to send in his travel journals
(B) To explain about a new subscription plan
(C) To inquire about his travel plans
(D) To determine his qualifications for a position

answer.text: (B) To explain about a new subscription plan
answer.explanation: “We at Travel & Recreation thank you for your subscription to our magazine. As you have been a long time subscriber, I am excited to inform you about our new subscription plan for our VIP members. ”

question.text: What did Ms. Adams send with the letter?

answer.explanation: "Please fill out the application form that is attached to this letter".

question.text: In the middle of the first paragraph of the letter, the term “at no extra cost” is closest in meaning to:

answer.explanation: "You can simply download a digital version of the print magazine to any mobile device at no extra cost."

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence belong?
“Your subscription expires next month, but we invite you to consider joining our VIP membership.”

answer.explanation: The before and after sentences of position number [1] are referring to VIP membership registration. So this position is most suitable because this sentence is also about to end

question.text:
More Buses During the Holidays

November 28- - [1] - Although the holiday season signals a nice week-long vacation for many, bus drivers will work longer hours and straight into the holidays to accommodate the many tourists that are flooding the city this time of year and the shoppers that are busy buying those last-minute gifts. - [2] - The city announced new bus schedules for the next few weeks which included some routes where the buses would run all day and all night. While most buses stop running by 1:00 A.M., some parts of downtown will see buses running all night. The Bingham shopping district will also see buses running until 3:00 A.M. “This is when we have the most tourists and out-of-town folks coming to visit,” explained Mayor Bill Nate. “We felt it was important to provide the necessary services during this time.” - [3] - When the bus drivers’ union leader, Nathan Reiner, was asked about the new schedules he responded, "We worked out a payment that is agreeable on both sides and have enough drivers that can work in shifts so that there is no danger of overworking or exhaustion. Many of US will still get some time off during the holidays with our families.” - [4] –
What is suggested about Mr. Reiner?
choices: (A) He is happy with the mayor.
(C) He seems satisfied with the working conditions.
(D) He would like some time off for the holidays

answer.text: (C) He seems satisfied with the working conditions.
answer.explanation: In his reply at the end of the article, Mr. Reiner mentioned things like “payment agreeable to both sides” (possible salary negotiable with both parties), “no danger of overworking and exhaustion” (no danger of overworking or exhaustion),… This shows Mr. Reiner's satisfaction with working conditions.

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence belong?
“Overall, the city seems prepared for the influx of tourists and holiday shoppers as Christmas draws near.”

answer.explanation: A sentence with the word "Overall" is a sentence of general evaluation that will appear either at the beginning or at the end of the article. Here, we see that this sentence is a general assessment of the city's holiday preparations, so it is likely to appear at the end of the article after the whole article has talked about what the city does.

question.text: What is stated about the city during the holiday season?
choices: (A) It closes down for the holidays.
(B) Many visitors come from out of town,
(C) More taxi drivers lose their business.
(D) The citizens travel to other cities

answer.text: (B) Many visitors come from out of town,
answer.explanation: Information on accommodation “This is when we have the most tourists and out-of-town folks coming to visit”

question.text: What is the purpose of the article?
choices: (A) To report changes in public transportation
(B) To describe the city during the holidays
(C) To inform the public about traffic delays

answer.text: (A) To report changes in public transportation
answer.explanation: The headline that says "more bus", the purpose of this article is to report changes in transport vehicles. public communication during the holiday season.

question.text:
Ichiro Watanabe (9:30 A.M.)
Does anyone have ideas before the Friday department meeting for improving the inspection process for dental offices?
Suzanne Pafrin (9:31 A.M.)
There is too much paperwork. Perhaps inspectors could complete forms electronically:
Zachazy Qian (9:32 A.M.)
Great idea. That would eliminate paper completely.
lchiro Watanabe (9:33 A.M.)
That’s an effective way for us to save time and money, but how do we transition from using the current forms to electronic ones?' How would it inspectors be trained?'
Suzanne Pafrin (9:35 A.M.)
What if inspectors continue to use paper forms while they’re learning how to use the new electronic version?
Zachary Qian (9:36 A.M.)
That way, they would gain some experience with the electronic forms. And maybe we could hire instructors to train our inspectors so they’re ready for the transition.
Suzanne Parrin (9:38 A.M.)
Exactly. We could hold the training sessions here at the Labor Department.
Ichiro Watanabe (9:40 A.M.)
Great. I’ll propose these ideas at the meeting.
What are the writers discussing?

answer.explanation:
"Improving the inspection process .."

“Transition from using the current forms to electronic ones?"

question.text: What is suggested about the writers?

answer.explanation: "..and maybe we could hire instructors to train our inspectors so they' re ready for the transition."

question.text: At 9:38 A.M., what does Ms. Parrin most likely mean when she writes, “Exactly”?
choices: (A)She knows how many years of experience are required.
(B)She wants to make sure all the paperwork is accurate
(C)She thinks Mr. Qian’s idea will resolve a problem.
(D)She believes Mr. Watanabe’s estimate is correct.

answer.text: (C)She thinks Mr. Qian’s idea will resolve a problem.

question.text: What will Mr. Watanabe most likely do on Friday?

Attention Loyal Green Brew Customer!
Green Brew Cafe is redesigning our loyalty program - it's not just for coffee anymore! As a frequent customer, you're invited to participate in testing the new program. Interested? Go to greenbrew.com to read more and download the new Green Brew app. Then start accumulating points by enjoying our sandwiches, smoothies, and salads in addition to your favorite coffee drinks. When you post a review on our Web site, you will receive twenty extra points as a thank-you gift!

==========================

FinnD188 (8 July): Why is Green Brew changing its loyalty program? With the new program, the points system has changed. I have to buy twice as many coffee drinks to get a free one now. I like using the mobile app to pay, but I don't like the points. I think the program needs some rethinking before its official launch.
Alannah08 (14 July): Berthe's Beanery still has a punch card to earn free drinks - much simpler than this new system Green Brew is testing. I'll keep going to Green Brew as long as I can keep using my punch card, but when the new program replaces the old one completely, I'll probably go to Bertha's more often.
CoffeeBea (29 July): I was excited about the app, and it does make paying for purchases very easy. But it's much easier to earn drinks at other nearby cafe, and that's more important to me. I think Green Brew needs to make some changes before introducing the new system.

==========================

A lesson in Loyalty
By Hudson Aird
27 August
Maintaing customer loyalty can be difficult. Just ask Green Brew Cafe owner Taylah Carver. She recently began experimenting with a change to the cafe loyalty program to reward her regular customers. Instead of the old punch-card system, which rewarded customers for coffee purchases only, the new program allows customers to earn points for buying food items as well. The points are tracked through the Green Brew app, which customers download to their mobile devices. The app can also be used to pay for orders.
The program was originally scheduled to be introduced to the general public in September, but after nearly 60 customers tried out the app for a month, Carver decided to defer the launch. Most users liked the fact that the app allows them to pay using their mobile devices, but there were many complaints about the new points system. It now takes twice as many purchases before customers accumulate enough points to be eligible for a free coffee drink, and that was too much, reviewers said. The lesson, says Ms. Carver: know your customers
Why was the postcard sent?
choices: (A) To encourage customers to place orders online
(B) To announce a change in cafe hours
(C) To introduce a new price list
(D) To recruit customers to test a rewards system

answer.text: (D) To recruit customers to test a rewards system
answer.explanation: “As a frequent customer, you're invited to participate in testing the new program”

question.text: What is suggested about the people who posted reviews?
choices: (A) They received bonus points for reviewing an app.
(B) They often meet friends at Green Brew Cafe.
(C) They tried some new lunch items at Green Brew Cafe.
(D) They are pleased about a reduction in prices.

answer.text: (A) They received bonus points for reviewing an app.
answer.explanation: “When you post a review on our Web site, you will receive twenty extra points as a thank-you gift!”

question.text: What is implied about Ms. Carver?
choices: (A) She runs a business that competes with Bertha's Beanery.
(B) She is not the original owner of Green Brew Cafe.
(C) She expects sales to increase in September.
(D) She decided to find a new vendor for punch cards.

answer.text: (A) She runs a business that competes with Bertha's Beanery.
answer.explanation:
Ms. Carver is the owner of Green Brew Coffee (this can be seen from the article “A lesson in loyalty”). And according to 2nd review, this reviewer compares between Green Brew Cafe and Bertha's Beanery. Then, this person even said that if Green Brew changed the new points system, it would be more to Bertha's Beanery.
So, Green Brew Cafe and Bertha's beanery are competing with each other.

question.text: According to the article, what is a common criticism of a new loyalty program?
choices: (A) It is difficult to download the mobile app.
(B) Customers must spend more money to earn free items.

answer.text: (B) Customers must spend more money to earn free items.
answer.explanation: “but there were many complaints about the new points system. It now takes twice as many purchases before customers accumulate enough points to be eligible for a free coffee drink, and that was too much, reviewers said”

question.text: In the article, the word "takes" in paragraph 2, line 8, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: “It now takes twice as many purchases before customers accumulate enough points to be eligible for a free coffee drink”

question.text:
To: John Masterson (jmasterson@masterstrokeindustries.com)
From: Carl Ennens (cennens@gmail.com)
Date: December 30
Subject: Internship

Dear Mr. Masterson,
My name is Carl Ennens and I am entering my final year at Evergreen state College. I am majoring in industrial engineering here, and my liquid dynamics professor, Dr. Alcobar, recommended Master stroke Industries as a possible internship opportunity. Your company is recognized as a leader in flow research. If you would be willing to accept an intern for the coming spring semester, I could give you up to 15 hours per week of work, provided that you are able to write some performance evaluations that I could turn in to Dr. Alcobar for credit. Thank you for your consideration, and if you would like to see my transcript, I would be happy to forward it to you.
All the best, Carl Ennens

==========================

To: Carl Ennens (cennens@gmail.com)
From: John Masterson (jmasterson@masterstrokeindustries.com)
Date: December 31
Subject: Internship

Dear Carl Ennens,
I appreciate your interest in interning with US here at Master Stroke Industries. We have not accepted a lot of interns in the past, but I know Dr. Alcobar personally, and if he recommended that you contact US, he must have faith in your ability. I think we should set up an interview at our headquarters downtown on Holly street. We can get to know each other a bit over some coffee and I will show you around our facilities. Don't worry about your transcripts; like I said, if Dr. Alcobar thinks you’ll be a good fit, I’ll trust his judgment. How about this coming Friday at 10 A.M.?

Look forward to meeting you Carl,
John Masterson
CEO, Master stroke Industries

==========================

Memorandum To Master stroke Industry Employees


This spring, at Master stroke Industries, we will have an intern assisting US with everything from making coffee to solving complex equations. Carl Ennens is a student here at the University and has kindly offered his services in exchange for a piece of our operational knowledge. Please treat him with respect and don’t be afraid to use him for an extra pair of hands, eyes, or opinion should you need it. And I did hear he makes a good cup of coffee!
What is indicated about Dr. Alcobar?
choices: (B) People do not appreciate his opinion.
(C) He is respected by John Masterson.
(D) He has done a lot of prominent research.

answer.text: (C) He is respected by John Masterson.
answer.explanation: You can infer from John Masterson's attitude in the second email: “if Dr. Alcobar thinks you'll be a good fit, I'll trust his judgment ”

question.text: Accordingto the memorandum, what will Carl Ennens be expected to do?

answer.explanation:
In the memo there is says Carl will do a lot of kinds of things “assisting us with everything from making coffee to solving complex equations” (assisting everything from making coffee to solving complex calculations)
“use him for an extra pair of hands, eyes, or opinion should you need it ”

question.text: In the second e-mail, the term “headquarters” in the fourth line is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: What is indicated about Carl Ennens?
choices: (A) He is a senior in high school.
(B) He is a junior in college.
(C) He will graduate in two years.
(D) He is a senior in college.

answer.text: (D) He is a senior in college.
answer.explanation: Information in first sentence of first email “My name is Carl Ennens and I am entering my final year at Evergreen State College”

question.text: What position does John Masterson have in the company?

answer.explanation: Carl writes a letter to John Masteron to apply for an internship, so this should be someone in the role of human resource operator or general manager. Thus, answer A is the most suitable.

question.text:
From: Optieris Office of Parking and Transportation
To: All Optieris staff
Date: December 20
Subject: Upcoming enhancements to our shuttle bus System
In direct response to your helpful feedback, we would like to announce a number of improvements to the shuttle System that connects the Optieris campus with the Morbrook and Nesse train stations. The following changes will go into effect on January 2:
(1) A third bus will be added to our fleet to increase service frequency as well as capacity in case one bus is ever down for maintenance. Buses will now run every 15 minutes instead of 30 minutes.
(2) A second campus stop will be added. Besides the current stop at the main administration building on the east side of the Optieris campus, there will be a second stop to better accommodate all our staff.
(3) A Service will be added in the evening. It will depart the Optieris campus 30 minutes later than the current last Service of the day.
Thanks again for your input. For the sake of our environment, we are proud to facilitate your use of public transportation by making our shuttle bus Service more convenient than ever.
===============================
@PS@/kstoeic/images/4597009_1584927659218.png@PE@
===============================
From: Sofia Edgren
To: Sharani Khamis s.khamis@optieris.com
Subject: Applicant interview at Optieris
Date: January 25
Dear Ms. Khamis,
Thanks for inviting me to an interview with Mr. Rochon next week on the Optieris campus. I am certainly excited to be a finalist for this position in quality control, I also appreciate your sending me the company shuttle bus schedule. I will take a train arriving at Nesse Station at 7:55 A.M, and then your shuttle bus upon arrival, which should get me to your West Campus at a reasonable time.
Sincerely,
Sofia Edgren

choices: (B)The current bus fleet is getting old.
(C)More staff are Corning to work by train.
(D)Optieris has built new facilities on its campus.

answer.explanation: In direct response to your helpful feedback, we would like to announce a number of improvements to the shuttle system that connects the Optieris campus with the Morbrook and Nesse train stations.

question.text: What will be one change to the bus system from January 2 ?
choices: (C)Each bus will follow a different route.
(D)The first morning bus will run earlier.

answer.explanation: (1) ... Buses will now run every 15 minutes instead of 30 minutes

question.text: What bus stop will be added to the route?

answer.explanation: (2) A second campus stop will be added. Besides, the current stop at the main administration building on the east side of the Optieris campus, there will be a second stop to better varied all our staff.

question.text: Why will Ms. Edgren visit the Optieris campus?
choices: (A)To finalize a contract between her company and optieris

answer.explanation: Subject: Applicant interview at Optieris.

question.text: What time does Ms. Edgren expect off her bus at Optieris?

answer.explanation:
I will take a train arriving at Nesse Station at Nesse at 7:55 AM, then your shuttle bus upon arrival.
- Get on the bus at 8:00 -> take the West Camp at 8:27

question.text:
Questions refer to the following e-mails and order form

To:Raquel Jenkins- cservice@starproducts.com
From:Jose Ramos - jramos.zipnet.com
Date:October 14
Subject:Defective Hose

Dear Ms. Jenkins,
Recently, I purchased 5,000 yards of XP100 industrial hosing from your company, star Products. The hosing was listed as capable of handling up to 1,000 pounds of pressure per square inch (psi). My company, Advanced Dynamic Cleaning, refitted all of our pressure washers with your hosing at considerable cost and time. Every single one of our pressure washers failed somewhere along the hosing from the joint of the gun to the compressor. Our compressors only create 500 psi, so I have to conclude that there is some defect in the design of your hose. I would like to get a refund of my purchase or a replacement of my order with hosing that meets industry standards. I have included my purchase order and a copy of the invoice.

Sincerely,
Jose Ramos
===========================

To:Jose Ramos - jramos.zipnet.com
From: Raquel Jenkins- cservice@starproducts.com
Date:October 16
Subject:Defective Hose

Dear Mr. Ramos,

We have received your report of a defective hose and reviewed the attached documents. We really value your business and hate that you went through such a waste of time and energy with our hosing. However, I am afraid to say that the mistake may be on your end. In looking over your purchase, you clearly ordered XP100 hosing X 5,000 yards. If you look at the specs for that hosing, it is only rated at appropriate for 100 psi. This could explain why all of your hosing failed. What I can offer you is an exchange of the remaining XP100 hosing in your inventory for a hosing more appropriate to your needs. We will do this at no charge and pay for the shipping as a show of our appreciation for your business. Please fill out the purchase order that I have attached and include it with the XP100 hosing when you ship it back to US for exchange.

Thank you,
Raquel Jenkins
===========================
@PS@/onthisinhvien.appspot.com/images/6789034_1592552433067.png@PE@
===========================
Why did Jose Ramos write to star Products?
choices: (C) To report a malfunction of hosing

answer.text: (C) To report a malfunction of hosing
answer.explanation: The content of the first email is to complain about the pressure hose and damage.

question.text: What is indicated about the hosing that Jose Ramos ordered?
choices: (A) It was not rated for the right PSI for his use.
(D) They were delivered to the wrong address.

answer.text: (A) It was not rated for the right PSI for his use.
answer.explanation: From the second email, namely, “In looking over your purchase, you clearly ordered XP 100 hosing x 5,000 yards. If you look at the specs for that hosing, it is only rated at appropriate for 100 psi. It is conceivable that the tube that Jose Ramos purchased is not suitable for the pressure to use.

question.text: According to the purchase order form, how much XP100 hosing is Jose Ramos returning?

answer.explanation: Order, Mr. Jose Ramos will get 2500 yards XP 1000. In the second email he said that he would return the remaining XP 100 tubes. So we can infer that the number of returns is equal to 2500.

question.text: What is indicated in the e-mail from star Products?
choices: (A) Star Products does not value Jose Ramos’ business.
(B) Star Products appreciates Jose Ramos’ patronage.
(C) Star Products doesn’t need any more business.
(D) Star Products wants to expand their business.

answer.text: (B) Star Products appreciates Jose Ramos’ patronage.
answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: “We really value your business” (We take business very seriously)

question.text: What job does Raquel Jenkins likely have?

answer.explanation: From the second email, it can be inferred that Raquel Jenkins does the job. receive customer feedback and send replies. As such, this is most likely the job of the customer service employee.

question.text:
Blooming Flower Yoga Studio

Summer Yoga Classes:
This summer we will be offering a variety of summer yoga classes for all age groups and skill levels.

Summer Class Schedule and Prices (registration fee):
Beginner class, twice a week for two months ($150)
Intermediate and advanced class, twice a week for two months ($200)
Yoga for senior citizens, once a week for two months ($100)
Hot power yoga, three times a week for two months ($250)

All necessary supplies will be provided by the Blooming FlowerYoga Studio. Members should wear comfortable clothes that allow for free movement.

45 Clark Street
Indianapolis, IN 46202
715-555-5832
www.bloomingfloweryoga.com

===========================

To: Tammy Glenn - tammyglenn@mxmail.com
From: Dwayne Moore - dwaynemoore@bloomingfloweryoga.com
Date: May 23
Subject: New Student
Attachment: New member form

Dear Ms. Glenn,
I’m writing to let you know that you have one more student who has signed up for your class. Your new student is Jane Meyers and she will bring the $100 registration fee with her to the first class on Monday.
Also, on Monday, please give Ms. Meyers and any other new members the form they will need to fill out. I have attached the necessary paperwork to this e-mail. All you have to do is to print out copies and hand them out.
Your class now has nine members that will attend and is, therefore, almost at full capacity. In fact, all of the classes this summer have proved very popular, and I anticipate they will all fill up by the end of the month. Thank you so much for your many years of hard work as a teacher here at Blooming Flower Yoga studio. If you have any questions, let me know.

Dwayne Moore
What is stated about the summer classes?
choices: (C) They are available to both children and adults.
(D) They are being offered at a discounted price.

answer.text: (C) They are available to both children and adults.
answer.explanation: Information is at the phrase "This summer we will be offering a variety of summer yoga classes for all age groups and skill levels."

question.text: What is indicated about Ms. Glenn?
choices: (D) She will be receiving a pay raise.

answer.explanation: The information is in the sentence “Thank you so much for your many years of hard work as a teacher here at Blooming Flower Yoga Studio ”

question.text: What is Ms. Glenn asked to do?

answer.explanation: Information contained in sentence “'I have attached the necessary paperwork to this e-mail. All you have to do is to print out copies and hand them out.

question.text: What is suggested about Ms. Meyers?
choices: (A) She has never learned yoga before.
(C) She wants to become a yoga instructor.

answer.explanation: In the email, it says that Ms. Meyers will bring in $ 100 in the beginning. Again in the advertisement, the only class that costs $ 100 is the senior class

question.text: In the e-mail, the word “capacity” in paragraph 3, line 1, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: "capacity" is the closest means with "volume".
